definitions.definition: A construction or natural feature that spans a divide.
Any of several electrical devices that measure characteristics such as impedance and inductance by balancing different parts of a circuit
A low wall or vertical partition in the fire chamber of a furnace, for deflecting flame, etc.; a bridge wall.
The situation where a lone rider or small group of riders closes the space between them and the rider or group in front.
A solid crust of undissolved salt in a water softener.
To be or make a bridge over something.
definitions.example: With enough cable, we can bridge this gorge.

definitions.definition: To span as if with a bridge.
definitions.example: The two groups were able to bridge their differences.

definitions.definition: To transition from one piece or section of music to another without stopping.
(communication) To connect two or more computer buses, networks etc. with a bridge.
To go to the bridge position.
